Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior reserved with two narrow brown lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: According to Williams (1983, 169), Type B1 kantharoi have two painted lines on the exterior surface of the sherd at the level of the handle root. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1467) (phase 2)
